title: How to Use the Lookup Function in Excel

steps.title: Create a two column list toward the bottom of the page.
steps.content: Create a two column list toward the bottom of the page. In this example, one column has numbers and the other has random words.

steps.title: Decide on cell that you would like the user to select from, this is where a drop down list will be.
steps.content: Decide on cell that you would like the user to select from, this is where a drop down list will be.

steps.title: Once you click on the cell, the border should darken, select the DATA tab on the tool bar, then select VALIDATION.
steps.content: Once you click on the cell, the border should darken, select the DATA tab on the tool bar, then select VALIDATION.

steps.title: A pop up should appear, in the ALLOW list pick LIST.
steps.content: A pop up should appear, in the ALLOW list pick LIST.

steps.title: Now to pick your source, in other words your first column, select the button with the red arrow.
steps.content: Now to pick your source, in other words your first column, select the button with the red arrow.

steps.title: Select the first column of your list and press enter and click OK when the data validation window appears, now you should see a box with an arrow on, if you click on it your list should drop down.
steps.content: Select the first column of your list and press enter and click OK when the data validation window appears, now you should see a box with an arrow on, if you click on it your list should drop down.

steps.title: Select another box where you want the other information to show up.
steps.content: Select another box where you want the other information to show up.

steps.title: Once you clicked that box, go to the INSERT tab and FUNCTION.
steps.content: Once you clicked that box, go to the INSERT tab and FUNCTION.

steps.title: Once the box pops up, select LOOKUP & REFERENCE from the category list.
steps.content: Once the box pops up, select LOOKUP & REFERENCE from the category list.

steps.title: Find LOOKUP in the list and double-click it, another box should appear click OK.
steps.content: Find LOOKUP in the list and double-click it, another box should appear click OK.

steps.title: For the lookup_value select the cell with the drop down list.
steps.content: For the lookup_value select the cell with the drop down list.

steps.title: For the Lookup_vector select the first column of your list.
steps.content: For the Lookup_vector select the first column of your list.

steps.title: For the Result_vector select the second column.
steps.content: For the Result_vector select the second column.

steps.title: Now whenever you pick something from the drop down list the info should automatically change.
steps.content: Now whenever you pick something from the drop down list the info should automatically change.
